TicketProblem.Notes:
Can you look into this for me?
This is the error I am getting when I am trying to send a work order.  Also I am un checking the box that says show wo/so on screen, and its still showing it on the screen before it gives me this error. 

No, it should use the Ticket:Best Buy 1st QTR PM Checklists report

TicketSolution.Notes:
It looks like this is due some changes recently made to the WOSO script.  I see quite a few issues that would cause this in the GetReportName function.  It is invoking reports instead of returning the name of the report.
 
I also noticed that PM 3rd for Best Buy will not do anything and this will cause errors. Should this also be the same as the other 3 quarters? (first 2 highlighted lines)
 
For future reference:
                There are two procedures in the script.
The first sub, invokeWOReport, will actually invoke the report with “Application.BasicFunctions.DoInvoke”.
The second function, getWOReportName, will return the name of the report being used with “getWOReportName =”.  
When you copy the conditions from the first sub into the second function you will want to edit the line to return the report name, rather than invoke the report.
 
 
If you can quickly verify the Best Buy question, I have the rest of the script fixed up.

TicketProblem.Notes:
We are trying to understand how to programmatically retrieve data from SLX Contact group.
We basically need to get a list of unique ("CONTACTID","EMAIL") from a CURRNT contact group:
 
I found an example in SLX code that use: Application.BasicFunctions.GetGroupRecordset(strCurrentGroupID,Array("CONTACTID","EMAIL"))
But I don’t see this API call in a “LAN Developers Reference” v7.5 that you send to Scott. Is it undocumented future? Or it’s been introduced in SLX 8.1?
Can we use it, if yes then can you explain to us “input Parameters” and “Return value”.
 
Or there is a better way to extract data for given Contact group “PluginID”.

TicketSolution.Notes:
I haven't heard of the GetGroupRecordset api function.

What we usually use is the GetGroupIDs. 
Once you have the IDs you can iterate through them and get the email address for each.

Thanks!
Anosh


GetGroupIDs

Function

When used in conjunction with GetGroupValue, GetGroupCount, CloseGroup, CloseAllGroups, this function returns a reference to the Group record set.

Object

Application.BasicFunctions.GetGroupIDs

Syntax

GetGroupIds()

Parameters

 

 

FamilyName

(String)

 

GroupName

(String) GroupName can be the name of any "valid" group in SalesLogix.

 

Returns

String

 

Example

Sub ShowGroupIds

Dim strGroupID

Dim intCount

'Returns the unique IDs for the specified GroupName

strGroupID = Application.BasicFunctions.GetGroupIDs("Contact", "All Contacts")

For intCount = 1 to 5

MsgBox "The PrimaryID for the current 'group' record is: " _

& Application.BasicFunctions.GetGroupValue(strGroupID, intCount)

Next

End Sub

TicketProblem.Notes:
Report Issue - Summarized Activity Report by Regarding & Category not working.  wondering if you can create a tab group report to get at this info for me? Please call - thx - this was a custom item you created for us - complicated

Failing to generate the correct data

TicketSolution.Notes:
To clarify is the report failing to run? Or is it just not generating the data you need?

In case it's the report that was failing to run altogether, I just restarted the Saleslogix Job service. Can you try again and see if that resolves the issue please? If it's not the report that's failing and you need something else, please let us know.

What data are you expecting that is not showing in the report?  I tried to give you a call but did not get an answer.  Give me a call if you would prefer to discuss this.

GTA to assist with gorup and discuss report issue.

Update:
We looked into this issue and this report was originally setup to allow you to pick from the Regarding and Category list. So originally when you ran the reports, your selection criteria looked something like this:
Inline image 1



However with your last SalesLogix upgrade, unfortunately this functionality changed.....it no longer lets you dynamically pull the list of Regarding and Category values from the database when you run the report.
You had emailed us about this back in 2014 and Ben had responded to you (email thread below). 
Unfortunately at this point your options are:
1) Run the report without the Regarding and Category filtering
OR
2) We can hard code the list of available Regarding and Category values. What this means is that if anyone adds a new value that is not in the hard coded list, you would have to type it in to add it to the report criteria.
OR
3) To make this work dynamically and pull data from the database each time when the report runs, you'd have to upgrade to a newer version of SalesLogix that supports this.

Please let us know how you'd like to proceed.

Thanks!
Anosh

TicketProblem.Notes:
New Address Default

So before when you added, it by default had the boxes checked necessary if only one address. So box “Primary Physical” and “Direct Mail” would be checked and we would change if adding another address.  Currently neither are checked. You can also add an address, save it, and not have anything checked. This will happen more than not. 

Is this correct or should these boxes be checked by default?

TicketSolution.Notes:
I assume you get to that screen when you try to add a new account or a add a new account/contact.

I verified different sources and the default behavior is to have those boxes unchecked when you are entering the address. However, once you hit save, the system will automatically check those boxes for you. Basically, you won’t have a case in which a new account is created and the address does not have those checkboxes checked.

Regarding the recent changes you pointed out, they were only label changes and did not modify the behavior of those checkboxes.

Please let me know if I can help you with anything else.

TicketProblem.Notes:
Wondering if it takes some time for the new contacts etc to be updated into CRM and for them to show up when I run that report.
I ran the “whats new report” about 20 min ago. Cindy said she had added some contacts etc, but I did not see anything in that specific area of the pdf. Nothing from steve either. The only two contacts who updated their information or added new contacts were Toney and Ryan, and their showed up.

TicketSolution.Notes:
Not really, they should show up right away.

Were new contacts added that aren't showing on your report?

Note that on a related note, I did work with Steve O'Brien today and help him sync his contacts. We initially synced down all his Outlook contacts, but that was way too many so we purged them out and then he's been selectively syncing a few at a time this afternoon.

So I'm going to guess what the issue is here.....when it prompts for the date range, don't choose the end date as today's date.
When you choose today's date, it assumes you mean 12:00 am on July 8th so it doesn't show any data added today.

Re-run the report and chose the end date as July 9th....and I think you'll see the results you're looking for.

TicketProblem.Notes: I’m getting errors like this frequently when trying to export data from SLX. Sometimes restarting clears it up but sometimes it does not. It’s happening several times a day—any suggestions?

TicketSolution.Notes:
Unfortunately we can't really do much about that, that entire functionality is hard coded into SalesLogix and not something we can correct/fix.
Sometimes Excel stays open in the background and that causes it to fail. You can try bringing up task manager and see if killing excel helps (its quicker than having to restart SalesLogix).
Other times its data related, and the export function fails on certain Date or Number values.
